text: Steingrímur Jónsson (14 August 1769 - 14 June 1845) was an Icelandic prelate who served as the second Bishop of Iceland from 1824 till 1845. ==Biography== He studied in the school of the Diocese of Skálholt and then in Reykjavík in 1788. He also studied theology in Copenhagen in 1803. He was appointed Bishop of Iceland on May 12, 1824, and he was consecrated by Bishop Frederik Münter of Zealand on December 26, 1824. In May, 1825 he was installed as bishop. ==References== Category:Lutheran bishops of Iceland Category:1769 births Category:1845 deaths Category:19th-century Lutheran bishops
title: Steingrímur Jónsson
